item.title: Classification Models (LDA)
item.description: Linear Discriminate Analysis (LDA) is a great classification method. It is simple and interpretable and can perform as well, if not better, than a lot of other fancier models (neural networks that are not interpretable). Introduction to Linear Discriminant Analysis (LDA) I will be using the Iris Data set again. First I will split it into a “training” set and a “test” set. The test set will represent the unseen observations.
